      • setupSession

        protected void setupSession()
        This method will be called at the end of onCreate(), overwrite it in order to select another connection type or other configurations. The type of connection can be changed after using selectBtConnectionType(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType) BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType#BT_SOCKET is selected by default with a DUPLEX connection. Here we can configure the future BT socket and BLE connections without starting either of them. This is useful for when the user changes between both types in the BtDevicesListDialog but we want to maintain the configuration of being simplex or duplex or the BLE profile between those changes. In any case, we can change it when the BtCommunicationListener#onPreConnectionChangesTo(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType) is called.

      • stopBluetoothConnection

        protected final void stopBluetoothConnection()
        Stops the current bluetooth connection but doesn't disable the BT adapter as the stopApp() method does.

      • stopApp

        protected final void stopApp()
        This method stops all threads of the BluetoothConnection and disable the Bluetooth in the mobile device if it was disabled before this app This is protected in case that a child wants to close when the user press a button or other view

      • selectBtConnectionType

        protected final void selectBtConnectionType(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType connectionType)
        Selects a new connection type (BT socket, BLE...) by closing the before connection type and opening a new one of the required type. This method will use default configure values for the connection types or the ones previously configured. BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType#BT_SOCKET is selected by default with a duplex connection. If you want to use non default configuration values for the bt socket or ble call to configureBtSocketConnectionType(boolean) or configureBleConnectionType(BleProfile) and then just call to this method in consecutive changes between types. Also, instead of calling this method, a connection type can be selected and configured by calling to selectBtSocketConnectionType(boolean) or selectBleConnectionType(BleProfile). Take into account that when selecting a type of connection in the BtDevicesListDialog, it will call to this method, so please configure the connection types before that or when the BtCommunicationListener#onPreConnectionChangesTo(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType) callback in invoked.

      • selectBtSocketConnectionType

        protected final void selectBtSocketConnectionType(boolean isDuplex)
        Select BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType#BT_SOCKET as the connection type to use. A simplex connection can be set by passing false as parameter if reading anything from the connected device isn't needed.
        Parameters:
        isDuplex - True if a duplex connection is required, false if a simplex connection is required

      • configureBtSocketConnectionType

        protected final void configureBtSocketConnectionType(boolean isBtSocketTypeDuplex)
        Configure a future possible BT socket connection to be duplex or simplex. This doesn't select, start or prepare that connection if it isn't has started, just configure it for a future connection. This method is also useful to be called when a configuration is required after changed to a connection type. If there is an ongoing BT socket connection it would change it to a DUPLEX or SIMPLEX one. See [BtCommunicationListener#onPreConnectionChangesTo(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType)].
        Parameters:
        isBtSocketTypeDuplex - True to configure a future BT socket connection to be duplex

      • configureBleConnectionType

        protected final void configureBleConnectionType(BleProfile bleProfile)
        Configure a future possible BLE connection to use a custom BleProfile. This doesn't start or prepare that connection if it isn't has started, just configure it for a future connection. If there is an ongoing BLE connection, it will be stopped. This method is also useful to be called when a configuration is required after changed to a connection type. See [BtCommunicationListener#onPreConnectionChangesTo(BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType)].
        Parameters:
        bleProfile - The BleProfile to use in a future BLE connection

      • selectBleConnectionType

        protected final void selectBleConnectionType(BleProfile bleProfile)
        Select BluetoothManager.BtConnectionType#BT_SOCKET as the connection type to use. A BleProfile can be passed to be used with this connection. The BleProfile contains the UUIDs for the services and characteristic we want to read in the connected device. The default profile is the com.bq.robotic.droid2ino.communication.ble.BqZumCoreProfile used to communicate with the BqZum Core boards.
        Parameters:
        bleProfile - A BleProfile to use in this BLE connection
